data.title: Bratislava
data.meta_description: Bratislava, officially the Republic of Bratislava (Slovak: Bratislavská Republika) (Literally Brother's glory) Is a republic in Central Europe. It is bordered to Poland to the north, the Czech Republic to the west, to the south Serbia, and the east Ukraine and Romania. Bratislava's territory is...
data.text:
Bratislava, officially the Republic of Bratislava (Slovak: Bratislavská Republika) (Literally Brother's glory) Is a republic in Central Europe. It is bordered to Poland to the north, the Czech Republic to the west, to the south Serbia, and the east Ukraine and Romania. Bratislava's territory is around 54,919 square miles, its official language is Slovak, which is part of the Slavic-Uralic family, the country is slavic and has a population of 1,789,410.

The slavic people arived in Slovakia in the 5th century, later the Muscovite Tsardom governed the lands in the 7th century. The Polish Kingdom occupied the modern borders of what is Bratislava now, the Kingdom of Hungary was formed in Budapest and expanded more than the borders of the modern country, later it was formed to Austria-Hungary until in the Trianon and other treaties it made Austria-Hungary collapse into Austria, the Czech Republic and Bratislava, Bratislava was occupied by the Nazi Germany in 1942 to 1944 when it was liberated by Soviet Forces, when Nazi Germany was defeated Bratislava occupied some of the Czech Republic, Nazi Germany's ally and some of the land of what modernly is Poland, which was annexed by the Nazis. Bratislava was made an Socialist State in 1950 by a revolution led by Dubcek John, the revolution was victorious and a new satellite state of the Soviet Union was made, in 1992 when the Soviet Union collapsed, Bratislava was made a Republic.

Bratislava has a medium-high income economy with a 711 Billion GDP, it has one of the fastest growth economy in NATO, EU and other organizations, Bratislava's currency is the Euro, its part of NATO, European Union, The Schengen Area, WTO, United Nations, and OECD.

The State's ideology is social libertarian, the power is shared by people, though the market is free, its considered a Libertarian Free Market Socialist state, Bratislava is one of the few left-wing states in the region, and has been criticized by other governments due to its left wing government, the government allows every type of parties in the country.

History[]

Roman Period[]

In 2 AD, The Roman Empire expanded to the East of Europe, finding Bratislavan Ancient tribes, the Roman Empire decided to attack them, the tribes surrendered quickly as they were weaponless. In the north of Bratislava, the Romans comstructed a building called the Aedificium of Bratislava, literally the Building of Bratislava, it was a 3 meter structure that was where most Romans slept and put their weapons. Islamic tribes from the North of Turkey had migrated as nomads to the East of Europe, and found the building, they attacked the building quickly, and the battle of the building started, the Romans won the battle with 1,000 Roman troops. The Roman Empire collapsed around 45 AD, and it was divided into the East Roman Empire and the West Roman Empire, Bratislava was part of the East Roman Empire.

Eastern Roman Period[]

The period started at 45 AD, Bratislavan and Roman tribes in the Bratislava region were developing and improving its economy, in 50 AD a 7.6 earthquake hit Bratislava, making the Aedificium of Bratislava about to fell, and around 40 Romans/Bratislavans died in this earthquake, during 60 AD Little Germanic Tribes from what today is Hamburg migrated near to what modernly is the Czech Republic, Bratislavan Tribes found this tribes and started to trade. In 70 AD, the Germanic Tribes in the Czech Republic formed the Kingdom of Bohemia, which was Romanized and in 86 AD it became a vassal of the Roman Empire. in 114 AD, the Eastren Roman Empire collapsed, the Bratislavan tribes made their own kingdom called Pannonia.

Pannonian Period[]

This period started at 116 AD, when the Pannonian Kingdom was formed in Bratislava, those tribes were romanized, and deveploved the town of Bratislava, at 118 AD, Slavic Tribes from Russian areas migrated,

and slavized Pannonia, at 150 AD, Pannonia was attacked by Germanic tribes from the north, which started a war, Pannonia won the war, and later in 160 AD Pannonia expanded to the East until it found the Black Sea.

Later Pannonian Period[]

In 250 AD, The Pannonian Kingdom was one of the most strongest civilizations in Europe, it had an empire from the Ardiatic Sea to the Black Sea. Pannonia was attacked by Turkish tribes during 270 AD, The Pannonians were defeated for the first time and the Turkish took resources and other from Pannonia, at 300 AD, the Kingdom lost most of its resources due to the Turkish invasions, and it's economy fell down, around 50,000 People lived in Pannonia which was shrinked to only Austria, Hungary, Czech Republic and Slovakia modernly, in 350 AD it was invaded by the Kievan

Rus, and it occupied it's eastren lands, in 400 AD Pannonia collapsed due to economic and social problems.

Slavic City States[]

in 450 AD, after Pannonia collapsed, Small Slavic States such as Bratislava and Budapest formed, those Slavic States lived from around 450 AD to 500 AD, argiculture was an sector of the economy of most of the states, such as Budapest. Bratislava was the strongest state in the area, it could take over city states like Nitra, its biggest extent was around 9466.5 square miles, Budaspet was a strong state too, and it took almost half of modern Hungary. In 498 AD, Bratislava and Budapest united into the 'Slogarian Duchy' which lasted just 2 years, the Slavic City states that were conquered by Bratislava and Budaspet were: Ostrov, Sustei, Buzau, Fuscani, Novi Sad, Szeged, Szolnok, Debrecen, Eger, Vac, Presov, Martin, Uzhohorod, Trnava, etc.

Slogarian Duchy and Huns[]

The Slogarian Duchy was formed when Bratislava and Budaspet formed to the Slogarian Duchy, it lasted for 2 years, due to the Hun invasion in 500 AD, The Slogarian Duchy was a strong and had a high-income economy, however, the Huns were much stronger, when the nomadic tribes of the Huns attacked Central and Eastern Europe, the Slogarian Duchy was affected, the Huns attacked the Slogarian Duchy, The Huns had around 10,000 forces compared to the Slogarian's 5,000, the Huns then annexed completely the Slogarian Duchy. The Huns governed the land from 500 AD until 700 AD, when the Muscovite Tsardom took over those lands when they defeated the Huns in a war.

Muscovite Tsardom[]

The Muscovite Tsardom conquered the Bratislavan lands from 700 AD to 900 AD, The Muscovite Tsardom had a war with the Huns, the Huns surrendered in 689 AD, then the Tsardom took over the lands in 700 AD, and it forced the natives to work, the Tsardom was one of the most authoritarian states in history, it was an authoritarian 'fascist' monarchy, the Bratislavans made a revolution in 900 AD to gain their independence because they were tired of being forced to do things by them, nations like the Finnish Kingdom suppored Bratislava, the Bratislavan War of Independence started, it lasted 3 years, from 897 AD to 900 AD, the Bratislavans had occupied most of the borders they wanted, the Tsardom gave up and gave the Bratislavans their independence.

Kingdom, Empire and Mikos Wars[]

The Kingdom of Bratislava was formed in 900 AD, it had a wealthy economy and many buildings, it had a

population of around 100K, the Kingdom was one of the strongest nations in the region and the continent, it had taken over some countries such as Transylvania, the Kingdom was lead by Svatopluk III in 950 AD, they had an conflict and constant warfare with Eastern Francia and the Germanic tribes, they had been behind

legacies in Europe, such as the Cyrllic script which was created in Bratislava, and that was sooner became the official script of other Slavic countries, charting a new path in their socio-cultural development, the administrative divisions of the Kingdom influeced other countries to make their own administrative divisions.

Great Bratislava arised around 1000 AD, it united most of the Slavic tribes (Not including the Russians) under one rule, the Slovak, Czech, Serbians, Bulgarians, and others, Bratislava was one of the biggest countries in the world, ruled by Mikos II, Mikos de-Germanized most of Switzerland, and it became part of Bratislava, Northern Italy was conquered by Mikos when Bratislava fighted with Italy.

Mikos II died in 1058, when he had around 80 years, Mikos III continued his legacy by making Bratislava expanding to the Adriatic Sea and to what modernly is Macedonia and Ukraine, and expanding the kingdom's economy, Mikos III also made the country an empire, Bratislava was the greater power of the world along with Chinese Dynasties, it had a fight with Francia again in 1078, and it won the war, in 1100, the empire had a big war, this was called the 'Mikos War' Mikos IV had taken over many countries, and he was named imperialist, Italy and others declared war on him to destroy Bratislava, around 300,000 troops battled for the Allies which wanted to destroy the imperialist threat of Bratislava, Mikos IV and his allies (The Ottomans and Finland) denied that Bratislava was imperialist, Bratislava officially declared war on them, 300,000 troops from the allies where placed on the borders, and many battles started. Such as the Battle of Thessaloniki, which was won by Byzantium, and Sevastapol which was won by the Russian Empire, after 20 years of long wars, Bratislava was defeated after mayor cities such as Bratislava, Athens, Belgrade, and others were captured, Mikos IV fled to Barcelona, Barcelona was part of the allies, Italian investigators discovered that Mikos had fled to Barcelona, he was found in an underground cave, and was assisted, this was known as many schools as the First Word War, as Chinese Dynasties and African Nations practiced too, for example Algiers which sen boats to battle France, which was part of the allies, and that was defeated by France, the Chinese dynasties supported the allies by sending troops and weapons.

Occupation of Bratislava[]

During 1119, Bratislava was occupied by countries such as the Russian Empire and Poland, the occupation of Bratislava nicluded religious conservatism, slavery, authoritarianism, far-right governments, xenophobia, racism, and others, Bratislavan historials consider this as one of the most chaotic eras that Bratislava has passed, this was known as the Bratislavan Genocide, during this occupation around 500,000 People died, The Russian Empire was responsible for most of the slavery, authoritarianism, xenophobia, racism, and far right governments, though other countries such as The Holy Roman Empire forced Catholicism to Bratislava, Bratislava was christianizated at 1134, and Bratislava was free the same year from the Holy Roman Empire, Poland and the Russian Empire, Bratislava didn't have wars, however, since the country was highly damaged due to the Mikos War and slavery, the country recovered by improving its economy.

Kingdom of Bratislava (1134-1220)[]

The 2nd Kingdom of Bratislava was formed at 1134 by Fico the 1st, its capital was established for the first time, Bratislava City. Bratislava improved it's economy and military after the Mikos War and its occupation, and became a libertarian kingdom, the country made a great legacy in Europe, the first politic parties and democratic elections were made in Bratislava, countries such as Poland followed this later, Bratislava was a member of the Holy Roman Empire for 5 years, those 5 years Fico the 2nd ruled the land, however, after 5 years, a new leader made the country leave it because it wanted to be free and govern itself. The Holy Roman Empire helped Bratislava a lot from 1150 to 1200 to improve its economy, and it had become one of the wealthiest kingdoms on the world, however, at 1220, Bratislava's king was killed by a coup d'etat and the country felt into Anarchy, as the country felt into anarchy, it was easy to other countries to take over it, Poland attacked the country, sending only 5000 troops which captured almost all of the north, then the rest of the troops were sent and Bratislava was fully captured by Poland.

Kingdom of Poland and Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth[]

The Kingdom of Poland conquered the anarchy after the coup d'etat happened, Poland had control over the land for many years, from 1220 to 1430. King Marcel I supported the idea of a libertarian kingdom, was Bratislava was, and it made a libertarian kingdom with politic parties, Marcel I claimed that Poland was going to continue Bratislava's legacies in Europe and make things, Poland invented things such as Chocolate in 1330, with help of Bratislavan native scientists, medicines were made too, the Kingdom of Poland soon united with the Duchy of Lithuania, and it became a great power of Europe and it was one of the greater powers in the world, not only Europe, King Dom of Lithuania and King Mark of Poland both united the

country and made a commonwealth, every year of the commonwealth it controlled Bratislavan lands, in 1398, The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth was invaded by the Russian Empire and the Ottoman Empire, France and the Holy Roman Empire supported The Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, 5000 troops were sent to Riga to guard the city of Russian forces, Fort Mod was a highly armed fort in Riga, Russian ships arrived at the Fort in December 28 of 1399, and there were more Polish-Lithuanian Troops, the Commonwealth won the Battle of Riga and other battles, though The Ottoman Empire captured two of Bratislava's biggest cities, Budapest and Bratislava, as they were captured, The Commonwealth sent many troops to both cities to liberate them, in January 5, 1400, both cities were liberated, in December 28 1405 the war was won by The Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth.

At 1430, the Ottoman Empire declared war onThe Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth with 800,000 Troops on the whole border, the Battle of Bratislava started in 8 December 1431 when the Ottoman army broke the walls of Bratislava, with 400,000 Troops, the Ottoman Empire had the advantage of having a bigger army than the Commonwealth which only had 200,000 left, the Ottoman Empire won this 3 day battle with only 70,000 troops left, the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth gave up as the 3rd biggest city was captured, later that area was annexed by the Ottoman Empire.

Ottoman Empire (1430-1660)[]

After the war with the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth, the Ottoman Empire took over modern Bratislavan lands, the Ottoman Empire was one of the greatest empires. In 1556, a refreshing was made, the Ottoman Empire had became more libertarian due to influence from the west, the City of Bratislava was renamed to Bratisul, in 1557, Tatars rebelled over the Empire, the Tatars occupied most of the north including Bratislava, although the Ottoman Empire defeated the Tatar army in Romania and Bratislava, Budapest was almost destroyed, the Tatars were soon defeated. The Ottoman Empire tried to get colonies in America at 1590 after a man told the Sultan about Columbus' trips, in the Atlantic Ocean, Spanish armada attacked the Ottoman ships as the Spanish were going to America to get colonies, the Spanish thought that the Ottomans wanted to rob their land, the Ottoman ship was defeated, after a man advised the Sultan about this, the Ottomans declared war on Spain, Spain won this war and gained South Italy and Croatia, Bratisul/Bratislava was attacked by the Spanish but wasn't damaged that much as other cities like Zagreb.

During 1604, the Sultan Mikuyum I centralized the nation by changing its economy, military, government, etc. Bratislava was a developed city and was ranked the 15th most populated city in Europe, after Mikuyum I died, Pasha Sebakan took power, in 1650, Poland declared war on the Ottoman Empire after the Commonwealth was dissolved, although the Kingdom of Austria had its own side, the Kingdom of Austria took over south Polish lands, Poland surrendered, Austria wasn't in the Ottomans' side, so it attacked most of Bratislavan territory, in 1660, Austria captured Budapest, Bratislava and Bucharest, making Austria-Hungary, the Ottoman Empire gave up and signed a non-aggression pact with Austria-Hungary later.

Austria Hungary[]

After Bratislavan territory was given to Austria-Hungary, Bratisul was renamed to Bratislava. Austria-Hungary was one of the strongest powers in Europe, in 1687, one of the greatest paintings in Bratislavan history was made, this painting made by Marian Kosic called 'Bratislava', it was one of the first paintings to paint Bratislava, at 1700, Austria-Hungary was invaded by the Russian Empire with 800,000 troops, Austria-Hungary defeated the Russian Empire and annexed some of its lands, years later, Poland invaded Austria-Hungary, in the Battle of Bratislava, the Battle was won by Austria-Hungary, Austro-Hungarian troops pushed Polish Troops to the Polish lands, Poland gave up, and it had to pay Austria-Hungary. After Romania won a war with the Ottoman Empire, it declared war on Austria-Hungary as they were weak after the war with Poland, Romania gained some land. In 1814, Austria-Hungary was invaded by Napoleonic France via the Vassal state of North Italy, most of Austria Hungary including Bratislava was occupied by France, when it attacked Russia, it was defeated and Austria Hungary was liberated.

When Austria-Hungary's king was killed by a Serbian man, Austria-Hungary invaded Serbia with almost all of its army, as Seria and the Russian Empire had a military pact, the Russian Empire invaded Austria-Hungary, Romania, Britain, Italy, France and Spain helped later Russia, the Ottomans, Germany, and rebels in British colonies helped Austria Hungary, in 1917, Bratislava, Budapest and Vienna were besieged by the Allies, and Austria-Hungary gave up, however, the German Empire was still fighting, after it gived up, this was what the treaties of World War 1 made Austria Hungary make:

Austria-Hungary will be dissolved to Bratislava, Austria, Czech Republic, and Serbia.

Austria-Hungary's Transylvania territory will be given to Romania.

Austria-Hungary must pay at least 95 Billion dollars to at least two Ally members.

Bratislava Republic (1918-1941), World War 2, 2nd Bratislava Republic (1945-1950), 3rd Bratislava Republic (1950-1992)[]

After Austria-Hungary was dissolved, the Bratislava Republic was a federated republic that was made in Austria-Hungary's dissolution, as the World War damaged Bratislavan lands, the republic had poor economy, although it had high civil rights, the Republic was supported by the former Ally members, in 1933, after Germany was controlled by the Nazis, Bratislava was protected by the Allies and the National Federal Army, after Germany invaded Poland, it invaded Bratislava,however, since Allied Army was strong in Bratislava, it took 3 years for Germany to conquer whole Bratislava, in 1941, the Republic of Bratislava was dissolved, in 1942, The Soviet Union was being attacked in the Stalingrad and Leningrad fronts, and made a 'terrorist' attack to the Red Square, in 1944, all Nazi troops were defeated to Germany, in 1945, Germany gave up after Berlin was captured, and the Bratislava Republic was made, with support of Bratislavan scientists, and other nationalities, the first nuke that would be used for a war was made, and Hiroshima and Nagasaki were nuked by USA, UK, Bratislava, France, China and Russian developed nukes.

When Bratislava Republic was made again, the short-living 2nd Bratislava Republic was vassalized by the USSR in 1950 in the Cold War, the Bratislava Republic's economy raised as the USSR took over, the country was protected completely by the USSR as it was its vassal, in 1992, when the USSR collapsed, Bratislava was liberated and became a republic, the vassalization of Bratislava in the Cold War was one of the only occupation of a Bratislavan state without slavery.

Modern Bratislava[]

After hte cold war at the fall of the USSR at 1992, Bratislava was liberated, in 1993 a Constitution for the New Republic of Bratislava was made, and the .bs demonym was created. The internet modernly is one of the most famous things in Bratislava, around 96% of the population use the Internet, Bratislava entered in 1994 the Eastern European Confederation (EEC) and has traded recently with many nations, Bratislava is planning to open international relations with several countries such as Uganda. Bratislava was attacked by a terrorist attack at 2004 made by Al-Qaeda or ISIS, this attack destroyed the Bratislava Center at Bratislava, Bratislava sent troops to Afghanistan and Iraq to fight ISIS, Al-Qaeda and Taliban forces. The current president, Alexander Vaclav, is planning to do the City of Velnagvaros, a planned city which will contain according to Vaclav a larger building than several towers.

The building of the Bratislavan railway was started in 2015, it starts from Bratislava to other cities such as Budapest, Bratislava's economy has been booming after the terrorist attack, recently, Bratislava is trading materials and money with other countries to make the Velnagvaros planned city, and make the planned Vaclav Tower.

Etymology[]

Bratislava's etymology's roots are unknown, the name was first mentioned in 4 AD, it was historically known for many years 'Pressburg'. The origin of the former Hungarian name of the country is unknown, a bit of Hungarian speakers still use the former name. Old scripts from the Roman Empire had been found in caves in Budapest, Bratislava, and the area where Velnagvaros is going to be constructed, translations of those can sometimes even mean 'Wratislava', which means that its possible that Bratislava was named Wratislava in Roman Times. One of the most possible theories of Bratislava's name is Brother's glory, which is the literal of Bratislava in Slovak.

Alternative Names of Bratislava[]

Wratislava

Pressburg

Posgon

Posgony

Bugalar

Bratislavum

Historical Names of Bratislava[]

Ponenium

Bratisul

Wratislava (Unknown)

Pannonia

Panon

Geography of Bratislava[]

Bratislava is situated in Europe, it's location borders Romania, Serbia, Ukraine, Poland, Austria, Czech Republic, Croatia, and Slovenia, in total 8 countries. The landscape of Bratislava is mostly mountainous, there are high peaks in the Tatras, and there are 19 national parks in Bratislava, and Transdanubia is a hilly mayor region in Bratislava, it's one of the traditional regions of Bratislava. The territory of Transdanubia is 38,000 km², and almost contains one fourth of the country. Most of the rivers stream in the mountains, the Danube is a notable river in Bratislava, one of the highest points in Bratislava. The Buuk Mountains are notable in the South of Bratislava, according to several magazines it contains the most beautiful autumn. The Tisza is another notable mayor river in Bratislava, and it contains Lake Balaton, which is the biggest lake in the area. The Danube Bend is in Bratislava, it's a curve in the Danube near Visegrad.

Bratislava has hunders of caves in its mountains, only 15 are in public though. One of the warmest regions are the centre of Bratislava and Bratislava City, where temperatures can rise to 35 C in summer, in North Bratislava, it can reach 28 C temperatures, except in the Mountains, where it can go to 21 C. Winters are cold in the mountains, it can reach temperatures of -8 C, in the nights, and it can be colder. The Danube is the biggest river, while the Alps are the biggest mountains in Bratislava along with the Tatras, Bratislava has a continental climate.

Wildlife of Bratislava[]

Sheep are one of the most known animals in Bratislava, in national parks and mountains sheep can be found, in Transdanubia, sheep, goats and birds are normal in this area, a few fish can be found in lakes and rivers, there are many farms in Bratislava with chickens, in the forests of Bratislava, a bit of deer can be found. Most of Bratislava's meat come of sheep, which is the most common animal, cattle is the most common animal in Bratislava, and its the national animal of the country.
